text: (upbeat music)
- Our customers are telling us,
look, we don't wanna just see data.

We wanna be able to
turn data into insights,

whether it's imaging,
whether it's device data,

whether it's patient data
and electronic health record.
How do we turn that into insights?

What we've done is
built an entire platform

called Health Suite Platform,
which we built on top of AWS.

We took advantage of Amazon
SageMaker and Ground Truth,
bolted on top of HealthSuite platform

so that we now have an
enterprise-wide mechanism,
where our businesses and our teams
can actually build machine learning models

to be able to embed
that into the solutions

so that when the data is
presented to the customer,
to our customers, it's not just data,
but it's either operational forecasting,
it's clinical prediction.

And so now you have both
application deployment,
that's using HealthSuite platform onto AWS

and you also have data
liquidity that comes back

using to build models, which
gives insights to scale
to our customers, which is exactly
what they were asking for.
AWS is highly scalable, secure, compliant,
a global cloud provider that enables us

to focus on what
differentiates us in the market

and AWS takes care of all the
under pressure heavy lifting.

When you look at it from a
different dimension though,

Phillips and AWS share a
lot of cultural beliefs.
We have a customer first approach.
So you have cultural alignment.
We're both pioneers that are not happy

with the status quo, that
wanna push the envelope

and change the way, it's
like working in the future.
